title: 'Match Found' Alert
body:
Missed so many starts because I missed the 'Match Found' low whooshing sound.
How about a more audible alert like a ping, or the sword clash when you receive a ribbon?

replies.body:
In higher tiers, waiting for 20mins or so isn't uncommon, so it's perfectly understandable for people to play other games while waiting in queue. With the current queue alert, it is easy for the match alert to be drowned out by other things unless they tune up their League volume to exceptionally high levels compared to other games.

Even average players don't want to have to watch their League for 3-4 mins; I'm not saying that it's ok to afk or something like that when in queue but they should at least be able to rely on their ears to hear the alert and be able to look at something else while waiting.

The disadvantages of implementing a more noticeable alert are minimal, and having a more noticeable alert will be beneficial to a lot of people.
The sole disadvantage would be ruining the aesthetic that Riot has going.

This. I have to agree. If i am queuing for a match, i make a point to have the volume up if I walk off to get a drink etc so i can hear it, or if i have headset setup, i make a point to do everything else before I start queue.
My average Q times are <= 2mins, it really is not that long to wait. Google something random in the mean time, the Client always steals focus when a match is found anyway ;)

For my 'Match Found' alert, have 'Royalty Fanfare Horns - sound effect'; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IwFn00raNzs
Used YTD 'YouTube downloader' to rip and convert to mp3. Renamed to 'matchmakingqueued', and replaced.
Haven't missed a start since... and goes well with the LOL ambience. 

P.S. Patch didn't revert the mp3, but repair does

Thank you so much man! Exchanged that mp3 file, restarted client and it worked a treat! 
Now have a brilliant 'Match Found' alert!
Restarted again, and the launcher did not 'repair' it. Awesome! :D

Yes it does, which is fine if I'm looking at the screen:

'..instead of being glued to my rig, excitedly watching that timer, that sometimes I get distracted by TV, music, mobile, etc.'

I'm sure you'll also be beeping horrified to hear, that I don't stare at my alarm clock, phone, oven, microwave, washing machine, smoke detector, etc., etc., until they 'magically' make a clearly audible sound.

i haven't had any problems hearing it either way.

anyways, I'll give you my theoretical solution

1. make your way to lol> rads> projects> lol_air_client> releases> 0.0.1.212 (or w/e # you have)> deploy> assets> sounds> 

2. scroll down and grab that "matchmakingqueued.mp3" file & drop it on your desktop or something

3. grab another sound file, rename it to "matchmakingqueued.mp3" and put it in the sounds folder

this might not work and it's likely you'll get a corrupted file error on the launcher and have to repair (which replaces your new sound) though if you're lucky, it'll last a bit until the error/next patch

Exactly! I have to admit instead of being glued to my rig, excitedly watching that timer, that sometimes I get distracted by TV, music, mobile, etc. 
Then, I glance up, to catch that last bit of pie diminishing, frantically grabbing for my mouse... Nooo!!!

Frequently there are one (or more) that don't Accept. With vastly varying wait times, I think that a sound with a higher pitch, like the clink of the champion select screen, or even better; a customizable sound, would make a world of difference to game starts. 

Found a clip on YouTube with a 'Match Found' horn sound: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2FCjqXkLJKA
It's a bit over-the-top, but certainly attention grabbing... Anyone know how to do this?
